Info Slide: Managed relocation is defined as the movement of species, populations, or genotypes to places outside the areas of their historical distributions. It is done to maintain biological diversity by saving the relocated organism or to protect the functioning of the ecosystem, in response to the effects of climate change.
Motion: THS the managed relocation of biodiversity in response to climate change
